description:
* Allow `add_deposited_particle_field` to take user-specified weighting field instead of always requesting "particle_mass", which does not always exist in simulations. 
* Fix and add name mapping for existing deposition methods.
* Expand `test_add_deposited_particle_field`.
* Deposition methods (except "weighted_mean") no longer take the weighted average of the deposited field. Thus, using "cic" or "sum" methods will result in a deposited field different than previous.
title: Fixing add_deposited_particle_field. Closes #1170

content.raw: For API backward compatibility (e.g. what would happen if someone was using `kernel_name` as a positional argument?) I think the new keyword argument should come last.
content.html: For API backward compatibility (e.g. what would happen if someone was using kernel_name as a positional argument?) I think the new keyword argument should come last.

content.raw: It would be nice to get a test for this. See the existing tests for `add_deposited_particle_field` in the `test_add_deposited_particle_field` function in `yt/fields/tests/test_fields.py`.
content.html: It would be nice to get a test for this. See the existing tests for add_deposited_particle_field in the test_add_deposited_particle_field function in yt/fields/tests/test_fields.py.

content.raw: If you edit the title of this pull request to include the string "closes #1170", bitbucket will automagically close the issue when this pull request is merged.
content.html: If you edit the title of this pull request to include the string "closes #1170", bitbucket will automagically close the issue when this pull request is merged.

content.raw: Do you mean to add another test function in ```yt/fields/tests/test_fields.py``` to test the additional keyword argument?
content.html: Do you mean to add another test function in yt/fields/tests/test_fields.py to test the additional keyword argument?

content.raw: That's right. Or adapt the test that's already there to test the new keyword argument.
content.html: That's right. Or adapt the test that's already there to test the new keyword argument.

content.raw:
It looks like you eliminated the "count" weighting type. Can you elaborate a bit on that?

In principle we're fine with deprecating things, but there's needs to be a shim that allows the old syntax to work, possibly printing out a warning about it. I can point you to examples in yt where we do this if you want me to.
content.html:
It looks like you eliminated the "count" weighting type. Can you elaborate a bit on that?

In principle we're fine with deprecating things, but there's needs to be a shim that allows the old syntax to work, possibly printing out a warning about it. I can point you to examples in yt where we do this if you want me to.

content.raw:
I removed the "count" method since it should have already been added in `setup_particle_fields`, which calls `particle_deposition_functions`. It also doesn't make sense to "count" a particle field.

It would be great you can point me the examples!
content.html:
I removed the "count" method since it should have already been added in setup_particle_fields, which calls particle_deposition_functions. It also doesn't make sense to "count" a particle field.

It would be great you can point me the examples!

content.raw:
Here's an example of a deprecated keyword that's similar to the situation here:

https://bitbucket.org/yt_analysis/yt/src/d47150dfbde64f0262903d954fc90f87ce95ca39/yt/frontends/athena/data_structures.py?at=yt&fileviewer=file-view-default#data_structures.py-455

content.raw: Thanks! I will add it later.
